Looks good...of course there is always a question of how long you
should let a species stagnate before purging it (the dropoff_age
parameter in my version of NEAT).  Also, if the population size chages
that's definitely a major problem that needs to be fixed.  It probably
indicates something wrong with the way offspring are being assigned.  
Anyway, looks like you already fixed it.

ken

--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, Colin Green <cgreen@d...> wrote:
> Colin Green wrote:
> 
> >>Right now I've switched back to checking over the search
algorithm. A 
> >>couple of things I need to look into are the population size
fluctuating 
> >>quite a bit (between 70-150 in a population that is supposed to be
150) 
> >>and also I have not imlemented the purging of old species
(droppoff_age 
> >>parameter) - which is something you mentioned on the list
yesterday 
> >>which I would expect to be quite an important part of the search
algorithm!
> >>    
> >>
> Quick update on this. I fixed the pop size problem and implemented 
> species culling... starting to get nice results now. As an example
of 
> the species culling working very well have a look at this log
output:
> 
> -----------------------------------------------------------------
> gen=775, bestFitness=88.00, meanFitness=61.36, species=10,
difficulty=8
> gen=776, bestFitness=88.00, meanFitness=64.93, species=10,
difficulty=8
> gen=777, bestFitness=88.00, meanFitness=63.62, species=10,
difficulty=8
> gen=778, bestFitness=88.00, meanFitness=69.39, species=5,
difficulty=8
> gen=779, bestFitness=88.00, meanFitness=67.82, species=3,
difficulty=8
> gen=780, bestFitness=89.00, meanFitness=69.45, species=3,
difficulty=8
> gen=781, bestFitness=89.00, meanFitness=71.17, species=5,
difficulty=8
> gen=782, bestFitness=90.00, meanFitness=68.34, species=5,
difficulty=8  
> <-- threshold of 90 achieved and therefore the task difficulty is 
> increased and the best fitness drops in the next gen...
> gen=783, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=64.32, species=6,
difficulty=9 
> gen=784, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=65.79, species=6,
difficulty=9
> gen=785, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=65.76, species=6,
difficulty=9
> gen=786, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=65.57, species=6,
difficulty=9
> gen=787, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=66.09, species=7,
difficulty=9
> gen=788, bestFitness=86.00, meanFitness=66.03, species=7,
difficulty=9
> gen=789, bestFitness=89.00, meanFitness=67.01, species=7,
difficulty=9
>
--------------------------------------------------
----------------------------
> 
> The search was stuck at a best fitness of 88 and then culled some
old 
> species away, almost immediately an improvement is seen. I saw this 
> happen several times in the handfull of runs I just did.
> 
> Colin.
